result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra L. Iverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DOC Collect; Hearing set 05-13-2016 at 2:30pm.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: The defendant's probation is extended for 1 year from 4/13/2021 to 4/13/2022.

Court held a hearing and after hearing from the Defendant, Assistant Corp. Counsel who represents Dodge County who operates the victimized facility, and the Assist Dist. Attorney, the court extended probation for one year.
